channel.title: foia on Freedom Of Information
channel.description: Recent content in foia on Freedom Of Information

item.title: 23-00001-CHAI
item.description: Emailed Gary Gensler directly (chair@sec.gov) to ask for help around the foia request for his emails. Received a generic response from the FOIA branch chief. I’ve sent previous emails to chair@sec.gov and this is the first one I have received a numbered response. Response Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 23-00009-REMD
item.description: What a saga searching for information about a closed Commission meeting. Steps to get to this remend: Submit 22-00069-FOIA and get rejected (Oct 2021) Submit 22-03086-FOIA and get rejected (Sept 2022) Appeal 23-00004-APPS to get sent back to FOIA office (Oct 2022) Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: / Complex - Still Consulting Letter Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 23-00321-FOIA
item.description: Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: / Response Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 23-00041-APPS
item.description: Appeal about the lack of response for emails. Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: / Decision Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 23-00322-FOIA
item.description: FTX filed for chapter 11 on Nov 11, 2022 and this FOIA was submitted on Nov 13, 2022. Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 23-00095-FOIA
item.description: Gary Gensler has another interview with Jon Stewart and pretends to be uninformed about retail investors direct registering their shares of GameStop. I requested “any and all emails to, from, cc’d, or bcc’d with Gary Genser containing keywords ‘computershare’ or ‘DRS’”. There has not been a response to this request. This request was appealed for not having a response in a timely manner. Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 23-00004-APPS
item.description: This was an appeal of the response of 22-03086-FOIA. This request was identical 22-00069-FOIA but was submitted a year later. This appeal response states the FOIA office did not perform an adequate review of the records. This appeal remended the request back top the FOIA office. Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: / Decision Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 22-03086-FOIA
item.description: See 22-00069-FOIA. This request is identical but submitted a year later. Received the same response as 22-00069-FOIA. However, this request was appealed. Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: / Final Response Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 22-03087-FOIA
item.description: This is a meta request looking for emails relating to 22-00069-FOIA. Having been through a few FOIA request/response cycles the initial 22-00069-FOIA wasn’t sitting right. Interested in any internal communications on why the initial request was withheld. Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 22-02530-FOIA
item.description: This request took lessons learned from 22-01697-FOIA and asked more questions. This request received a canned response that did not answer any questions or provide any records. This request was appealed. Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: / Response Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 22-02101-FOIA
item.description: The SEC produced a four part video series titled “Investomania”. Crypto, Margin, Easy Money, Meme Stocks. This series came out at a particularly bad time. This was about three months after Gary Gensler appeared on The Problem and mentioned SEC staffers taking donations for coffee in the office. Why is the SEC spending $366,205 producing and advertising this series while asking staffers to donate coffee to drink in the office?

item.title: 22-01697-FOIA
item.description: The SEC gathers and publishes information about institutional owners of stocks, but provides 0 information about retail ownership. I submitted this request seeking information about retail ownership of GameStop. I received a fairly canned response telling me to search company filings. This request/response triggered a more detailed 22-02530-FOIA which was appealed. Acknowledgement Letter Previous Next     Page: / Response Previous Next     Page: /

item.title: 22-00069-FOIA
item.description: This request was triggered by a strange series of events that transpired in 2021. April 13, 2021 Commissioner Hester Peirce releases Token Safe Harbor Proposal 2.0 statement - github May 11, 2021 An article titled “The Future Of Tokenized Stocks - What They Can Replace And What To Watch Out For” is released. This article was edited about a month later to more prominently feature SBF. May 12, 2021 Ryan Cohen posted this tweet from Arlington, VA GameStop which is a 12 minute drive to the SEC.
